With a unique, and unwavering, commitment to Practical Academics — “Pracademics”— and real-world results, The American College of Financial Services offers driven financial services professionals one of the most valuable, and most valued, educations you can receive. The College is distinguished by resources of the highest quality, innovation in program delivery and design, and results that create sustainable career advantages. As a nonprofit, accredited education institution, our courses are researched and written by a faculty of the nation’s top thought leaders in financial services. Our goal is to ensure that our students are viewed by clients and peers as the best and brightest in their fields.

The American College of Financial Services places a premium on quality education. The College works tirelessly to ensure that society has informed, ethical financial service and insurance professionals it can trust. Our degrees and designations are universally recognized as representing the highest standard in expertise and education. More than 200,000 professionals have learned and honed their craft here. What they have found is that in the complex world of financial services, the key to success is being better prepared than the competition. It’s why so many return to The College throughout their careers.

Whatever your goals, whatever your passion.

We believe that your education is never over. Whether you are just starting out in the financial services profession, looking to advance your earnings potential, or seeking greater career opportunities and satisfaction through specialization, we deliver premium financial services and insurance education options that are relevant, comprehensive, and convenient. We are dedicated to improving every facet of the financial services profession. From the creation of CLU
, our first financial designation in 1927, to the launch of our immersive, goal-based investment management program, the WMCP
, The American College of Financial Services continues to develop and deliver innovative programs that meet the needs of the changing financial landscape.
Comprehensive education in goal-based personal investment management. Focused on creating diversified and efficient investment portfolios that meet client goals, WMCP
gives advisors a competitive edge with new ways to manage wealth.
The nation’s best choice for advisors studying to become CFP
professionals. Our expert faculty ensure you are thoroughly prepared for the CFP
certification exam and for the rest of your career.
Advanced financial planning for every person and every need. With practical application-based content, you’ll be better prepared for greater success with the ChFC
Protect clients, their families and their business with the premier designation for insurance professionals.
Gain the practical and ethical skills you need to build a successful practice. The FSCP
offers the most complete skills training available today, with an emphasis on product knowledge and business marketing principles.
Accredited, advanced degrees. Become a better leader with MSM or master financial services strategies with MSFS, now available with specialty concentrations.

Active Duty, Veterans, and military spouses

The American College of Financial Services supports the men and women who have honorably served in the armed forces. We are committed to furthering your interest in the financial services profession through quality educational programs, support and career opportunities. We offer several online designation programs, master's degree programs, and supportive resources to help you begin and accelerate your career.

As a society, we are no doubt standing on the shoulders of giants who were both citizens and military professionals.  There are so many who deserve our gratitude for a lifetime of service protecting and advancing our way of life.
Ted Digges, Executive Director of The American College Penn Mutual Center for Veterans Affairs
Whether you are looking to enter into the financial planning profession or want to move ahead in your current position, The College offers education and career support in:

We're on a mission to help mission-driven people like you. The American College of Financial Services offers full scholarships for active duty personnel, veterans, and military spouses. These scholarships can be used for all of our programs and are awarded based on military status, financial need, accomplishments, academic potential, quality of recommendations, and other special circumstances.
The American College Penn Mutual Center for Veterans Affairs

Our Center for Veterans Affairs provides leadership training, educational support, and career opportunities for eligible men and women who have served honorably in the armed forces, and their spouses. Through our mentoring program and relationships with financial organizations, we help you move into leadership positions and develop practices that serve you and your clients for life.

Clients need future financial advisors like you to help them manage their finances wisely, and you have the discipline, loyalty, and integrity it takes to make a significant difference in their lives.
Visit The American College Penn Mutual Center for Veterans Affairs

Paul Henderson (Norfolk, VA) is an active duty Navy Lieutenant Commander currently stationed on aircraft carrier USS ABRAHAM LINCOLN (CVN 72). An Annapolis graduate, he spent several years as a helicopter pilot, which included a tour where he was hand-selected for an assignment with 5th Fleet in Bahrain. During this tour, he was able to sit in on high-level meetings chaired by then General James Mattis. He says, “I went into the Navy to fly, but I have stayed in because of the people and camaraderie.” During another tour, a tragic accident swept a fellow helo pilot overboard into the Red Sea. Seeing his shipmate’s wife struggle with no life insurance was one of the inspirations for him to begin laying the groundwork for a career in the life insurance profession. While he still has several years prior to his transition, he has already earned his life and health license and serves as the command financial specialist. He will be pursuing the Chartered Life Underwriter
) designation. He considers taking care of families and loved ones when tragedy strikes a noble profession.

The American College’s graduate degree programs are approved by the US Department of Veteran Affairs for Post 9/11 GI Bill benefits. Our graduate degree programs comply with the requirements of Title 38 Chapter 36 of the US Code (administration of Veteran’s Education Benefits). In Pennsylvania, oversight of Veterans Education Benefits is provided by:
Bureau of Postsecondary and Adult Education

for active duty, veterans and their spouses

We have a broad network with some of the best organizations in the financial services industry, many of which are very interested in former service members who have the work ethic and soft skills they are looking for. If you are interested in breaking into this industry or are simply looking for a change, let us know…we might be able to make a connection that results in a “win-win” for you and your new employer.

There are many complex financial areas of our lives: income taxes, estate planning, paying for college, retirement planning, investment options, etc. You can become the person that helps individuals develop an overall financial plan and then provide the encouragement for them to have the discipline to stick to it.

Work in a field where you are compensated for giving advice on investing in securities such as stocks, bonds, mutual funds, or exchange traded funds are deemed to be investment advisors. You can also manage portfolios of securities.

Some of the hottest jobs in finance are jobs in insurance. Insurance is a trillion dollar business that employs more than 3 million people in the United States alone. As the population ages and wealth grows, the demand for insurance professionals will increase dramatically.

America is getting older and needs retirement planning experts. Over 6,000 Americans become retirement age turning 65 every single day. This group is looking for individuals that can help them with this major life milestone. Learn how to best manage the asset distribution phase and minimize risk while maximizing benefits such as Social Security.

Learn about the management process of an organization’s workforce. This includes the attraction, selection, training, assessment, and rewarding of employees, while also overseeing organizational leadership and culture and ensuring compliance with employment and labor laws.

With the roll-out of the Affordable Care Act, many Americans need help understanding the law to find out what is the right path for them. Become an expert in group benefits, individual health insurance, and managed care. This is a growth industry!
Learn how to help families and organizations in the context of wealth distribution, charitable strategies, and gift planning in a non-profit context.

Use what you have learned in the military and gain an industry recognized credential in Leadership. This Master’s Program takes a year or more to complete and requires 10 advanced courses in strategy development, communications, leadership, management, law, compliance, ethics, decision-making, and interpersonal skills.
Welcome to The American College Penn Mutual Center for Veterans Affairs!

Our mission is to empower the men and women who have served honorably in the Armed Forces by providing educational support and career opportunities in the financial services industry. The crown jewel of our program is the full scholarship opportunity for active duty, veterans, and spouses.

Veterans are uniquely qualified for a career in the financial services industry because they come from a culture of service and “can-do.” In addition, veterans are typically comfortable operating in an environment requiring attention to detail, compliance, and appreciate different cultures and backgrounds. With the increasing complexity of tax, estate, insurance, retirement, and college planning, there is a real need for individuals of integrity to help others address life’s major milestones with confidence and success. Veterans can step in and fill this need so many are looking for.
I want to personally thank all of our donors, both individual and corporate, whose support is making a real difference. We are not only
, we are also infusing the financial services with a talent pool for the next generation!
Congratulations to this month's scholarship recipients!
Know how to handle the topic of risk with your clients. Professor Michael Finke met with Creator of the Sharpe ratio himself, Bill Sharpe, to discuss...
The American College Penn Mutual Center For Veterans Affairs

2016, Major General Josue (Joe) Robles, Jr., USA (Ret.)
The streamlined application process requires submittal of the following:
Copy of DD214/separation papers (if formally discharged from military), or an LES (if still on active duty)
The email addresses of three (3) individuals who can serve as references for you
Transcripts representing the highest level of education (
Official transcripts are only required for graduate school scholarship applications.)
Supporting financial documentation demonstrating financial need for scholarship (i.e. tax returns, W-2 form, or statement of earnings from employers)
If on active duty, salary will not be considered as a criteria. However, pensions will be considered.
After your application has been received, you will be contacted to schedule a phone interview. You will have a decision within 48 hours following the interview.
Completed your first program? For details on applying for a second scholarship, please contact Sheila Runkel, Program Manager, at
Veterans who have received an honorable discharge
A spouse of a qualified candidate or surviving spouse
Scholarships are awarded based on military status, financial need, accomplishments, academic potential, quality of recommendations, and other extenuating circumstances.
